intro: Linaria multicaulis var. messanensis, commonly known as the Messina linaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Italy. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and vibrant yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a perennial species that is often found in coastal and Mediterranean regions.
